entry.title: Vancouver Teardown Map
entry.content:
There has been lots of talk about old homes being torn down and replaced in Vancouver. The likeliest targets are houses of relatively low value sitting on expensive land. So how many teardown candidates are there in Vancouver, and where in Vancouver are they located? To answer this let’s set an arbitrary ratio of (assessed) house value to total (assessed) property value (house + land) of 5% and label everything below that a “teardown” candidate.

After downloading some data from Vancouver’s open data to build an interactive map to explore the low end of the building stock.

The short answer is that almost one in three properties in Vancouver fall into this category. And they are distributed quite evenly across all of Vancouver with some areas like downtown looking a little better.
